title: Ticket #7417: python-bindings use after free for transaction object
description:
a python 3 script that has this construction 
fragment of python code
with htcondor.Schedd().transaction() as txn:
    sub.queue(txn)
Will fail with the error
RuntimeError: Job queue attempt without active transaction
Because the Schedd() object will be destroyed as soon as the transaction() object is created, which in turn will disconnect from the schedd before sub.queue() is called.

We can fix this by using boost to force the schedd object to be alive as long as the transaction object is.

There are also some places in the implementation of sub.queue() that don't properly take the ModuleLock before using the condor API, this could potentially cause failures if multiple threads try and submit at the same time.
